channel.title: Generating Excel Files in C#
channel.description: I have been investigating several ways of generating files suitable for use in Excel from a C# application. As with most problems, there is more than one way to crack a nut. Various examples on the web show how to...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Ben+00:00
item.description:
Why not just output a comma-seperate-values file?
Column 1, Column 2 Row 1, Row 2
...etc.
item.dc:creator: Ben

item.title: Comment by Martin+00:00
item.description: I wanted the file generated to load into excel and appear to the user like it was a native excel file. A CSV formatted file cannot be saved with the XLS extension (it needs to be CSV).
item.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Scott Willeke+00:00
item.description: Our ActiveReports for .NET product (http://www.datadynamics.com) includes a component we call SpreadBuilder that provides a full API for creating binary excel files. If our customers continue to show interest in the product, we may improve this component even further in the future. Of course, ActiveReports can also export any of your reports to Excel automatically.
item.dc:creator: Scott Willeke

item.title: Comment by Ben+00:00
item.description: ...and ActiveReports for .NET can be obtained for the sum of.... ;-)
item.dc:creator: Ben

item.title: Comment by Tom+00:00
item.description: Don't know ActiveReports price, but ExcelLite .NET component (http://www.gemboxsoftware.com/ExcelLite.htm) does the same and costs 160 EUR (~$190). You pay per developer; server or client deployment is royalty free.
item.dc:creator: Tom

item.title: Comment by HRao+00:00
item.description: Hi How can write the percentage sign % into excel using C# . Please respond
item.dc:creator: HRao

item.title: Comment by Bibi+00:00
item.description:
Hi,
How can I implement and use this xmlwriter class? I copy it to XMLWriter.cs but httpresponse gives error? I'm a beginner to c# and it would be really good if you help me. Thanks
item.dc:creator: Bibi

item.title: Comment by Martin+00:00
item.description:
Bibi,
If you post the error that may help. My guess is that you need the appropraite "using" statement at the top of the class. Also - the class is called XLWriter, XMLWriter.
Cheers,
Martin.
item.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by hafiz+00:00
item.description: hi all...i have an excel image button when I click it will take the data from my page and download it as an excel file. When i drag and drop/or save it as a .txt file it shows all the crazy html/xml codes. I just want it to display as tab delimited contents. I am having very difficulty. can anyone help? thanks, hafiz (guile786@aol.com)
item.dc:creator: hafiz

item.title: Comment by Bibhuti Prasanna+00:00
item.description: Hi, I am not able to read data from excel cells if it contains errors. When the cell has data which has been converted from number to text, a green triangle appears on top left of the cell. It is then that the data reader reads a null value from that field. Using data set made no difference neither did disabling the background error checking of excel through code. Please help!!!
item.dc:creator: Bibhuti Prasanna

item.title: Comment by Michael Wright+00:00
item.description:
Hello,
I'm new at C# and coding in general. I created a C# Windows form from within Visual Studio 2008. I have a button that I want to execute a Stored Procedure; essentially a "Select" Sql query.
How do I implement the code that you have provided to execute my stored procedure and ouput to csv or excel either one?
Thanks for your time.
item.dc:creator: Michael Wright
